blogs.title: Will Opening Schools Worsen the Pandemic?
blogs.summary: School leaders won't have a clear answer before they must make decisions for this fall despite new studies and findings from reopenings in other countries.

author.name: Inside School Research
author.description: Reporter Sarah D. Sparks spent the last five years writing about federal and state education regulations. Now covering education research, she can most often be found with a double-shot mocha in one hand and the latest academic journal in the other. Join her in a discussion of the politics, personalities, and p-values in education studies, and help bring research out of the lab and into the classroom.

news.title: Children under 10 are less susceptible to infection

news.title: News story from Bloomberg on Monday 15 February 2021
What We Know About the Impact of Covid-19 on Children
news.summary: (Bloomberg) -- Young children typically are “superspreaders” of respiratory germs, so it’s puzzling that they don’t seem to be major transmitters of the coronavirus that causes Covid-19.

facebook.title: On the effect of age on the transmission of SARS-CoV-2 in households, schools and the community
facebook.summary:
Schools and COVID... 
This is a pre-print. Yet it is also just a summary of the authors' review of the literature.  

tl:dr
K-8 seems ok. 9th grade and beyond appear to contribute to spreading COVID.  

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7386533/
